treasury_media.title: What is hemodynamics?
treasury_media.description: What is Hemodynamics For explanation of unfamiliar terms, go to Glossary of Terms. For a detailed discussion of new concepts of systemic hemodynamics and hemodynamic management, click on the reference listed at the bottom of this page. Hemodynamics is an important part of cardiovascular physiology dealing with the forces the pump (the heart) has to develop to circulate blood through the cardiovascular system.

treasury_media.title: Applied Mathematics
treasury_media.description: Applied Mathematics is concerned with the development and exploitation of mathematical tools for the analysis and control of technological problems. Mathematical modelling of the problem at hand plays a basic role, followed by (numerical) analysis and (computer) simulation. Interaction with other disciplines and with specialists in the fields of application is essential.

projects.title: Building a Telco Management Environment called 1BDMZ
projects.description:
Building Red Hat virtual machines for the Telco application management environment for e.g. KPN's mobile telephony, KPN fixed telephony and The internet of Things solution Lora.
Both system builder and Technical Project Lead Linux. 
In the role of Technical Project Lead I also advise 
- the Technical Consultants how to translate functional requirements in the Linux specific technical requirements.  
- Project and Program management whether some vendor request should be honored, or not. If I give a positive advise, I specify under which conditions we honor the request.

contributors.headline: DevOps Engineer, B2B Solutions at KPN
DevOps Engineer

projects.title: Designing, and deploy an mailrelay solution to add to the KPN NIO BDMZ
projects.description:
The current solution to send emails from Application Servers in  production environments does not comply with KPN's security policies, and use network segments that should not be used.

The new solution will comply with the security policies and the requirements added by the KPN NIO ACN Innovation team.

At the moment (4-nov-2016) we are the stage that all requirements are implemented, I am waiting for a GO/NO GO decision to migrate all clients from the current solution to this new solution.

contributors.headline: DevOps Engineer, B2B Solutions at KPN

projects.title: Building an order picking application environment for warehouse company XPO.
projects.description:
I have build a Red Hat cluster for the production databases and supported the team that had to build the Red Hat virtual machines on which the warehouse order picking applications where installed.

This is an environment for a new market segment. 

Beside the build of the platform, I also had to support the performance test team.
Due to initial performance issues, I had to migrate the cluster configuration to new network segments.

contributors.headline: DevOps Engineer, B2B Solutions at KPN

projects.title: Virtualization of an existing local government application environment
projects.description:
Migrating physical servers to VMware using Ghost for Linux and Plate Spin.
The purpose is to extend the life cycle of the applications and databases after the life cycle of the hardware

projects.title: Proof of Concept: Civision built on SAP running on SUSE Linux Enterprise Linux
projects.description:
Civision built on SAP is a product of PinkRoccade Local Government.

Louis Van Hoef was part of the SAP development team, he provided information to the project team, what choice to make for the operating system installation.

Teun Vos and I were the Linux specialists.

Project lead was my second task in this project.

After the Proof of Concept: SUSE Linux Enterprise Linux has been added to the list of operating system to provide Civision built on SAP.

This was an innovation on the portfolio, traditionally Civision products were only made available on Windows, HP-UX and OS/400.

Linux implementations (mainly RHEL, secondary SLES)

Successfully integrated a RHEL 7.1 client with a single Win2012R2 AD.

Will test a chain, where the servers integrate with AD in Domain1 and the users are in AD in Domain2, where Domain1 has a trust with Domain2.

NON Busines statement:
===============================================================
This just a family/friends webserver coupled to my domain names
It is not a real organisation.
I do not have any intention to do business with whom ever asks as long as I am employed by a real company.

The websites only provide services to family and friends.

Neither will the webserver kootstra.co.uk provide any service out side the family or friends.

So do not try to reach me for business deals. Business needs to be done my employer.

End of NON Business statement.

The intention of this virtual employer is: to be able to create recommendations to friends outside my work who I run websites for.

profile_positions.title: Junior programmer

profile_positions.description:
Researching a possible link between blood flow profiles (shear tress), and the beginning of arteriosclerosis in the femoral artery just above the knee.

Testing two hypothesis already known in the medical community. These hypothesis point to hyper- or hypo-stressed areas of the vascular wall.

The hypo-stressed areas best fitted the computer model to the areas found in victims.

This "job" was part of my masters training:

My master thesis has lead to my first publication in a scientific journal:
H.W. Hoogstraten, J.G. Kootstra, B. Hillen, J.K.B. Krijger & P.J.W. Wensing: Numerical simulation of blood flow in an artery with two successive bends. Journal of Biomechanics, Volume 29 (8) 1996 1075-1083.

Besides Fluid Dynamics I studied different subject in Mathematical engineering and Mathematics in general. I only decided to specialize in june 1992.
profile_positions.title: graduate student/junior researcher

volunteer_experiences.description: Reviewing the chapters of Mastering VMware vSphere Storage/Monitor and optimize capabilities of your vSphere environment. ISBN 978-1-78217-485-1

Helping two students from Venezuela to get information they need for there graduation project to become BSc in Aerodynamics.

As a MSc in fluiddynamics I had, and still have contacts at the Univerisity of Groningen, I received the questions in English, had to translate the questions to Dutch. The answers I had to translate from Dutch to English. When possible I would answer questions by myself.

One of the two students made it to Post Doc at the Univerisity of Genova in Italy, after doing his Master studies in Toulouse France, and his PhD studies in Genova Italy.
Give advise and support to Red Hat customer's world wide. Also learn from other senior members on the community forum.

Red Hat Accelerators are a group of customers who give input/feedback to teams with in Red Hat to improve the products or influence Roadmaps.

Elected Captain in December 2020
